snippet: A computer program developed at I.B.M. uses game techniques and psychology to influence dieting: eat a salad, for example, and you could win 50 cents.
abstract: Nicole LaPorte Prototype column on IBM inventor Michael Paolini, who was part of a group behind company's new patent for a computerized system that tracks food intake and rewards good choices; notes the system, which uses game techniques and psychology, may eventually help companies and insurers encourage healthier habits among their employees.
lead_paragraph: A computer program developed at I.B.M. uses game techniques and psychology to influence dieting: eat a salad, for example, and you could win 50 cents.

headline.seo: An I.B.M. Computer Program Rewards Healthy Diets
headline.main: Dieting for Dollars (or Maybe a Movie Ticket)
headline.print_headline: Dieting for Dollars (or Maybe a Movie Ticket)
